Example 1 (continued)

(c) Total number of stickers the boys collect:
$= 450 + 750 + 375 + 500$
$= 2075$

Total number of stickers after each of them collects $50$ more:
$= 2075 + 200$
$= 2275$ stickers

Alternatively:
$= 2075 + 4 \times 50$
$= 2075 + 200$
$= 2275$

The boys will have $2275$ stickers altogether.

**Take Note**

1. It is important to note the scale carefully for each graph and consider the values accordingly.

2. Write down the value of each "bar" to start with. This will come in useful later. It will save you a lot of time in working out the answers.

3. If a question contains more than one part, often the solution of parts (a) and (b) can help you work out parts (c) and (d) more quickly.
